channel.title: WTH, 2 million files?
channel.description:
I ran my AV like I do every week, and this time I noticed how many files it actually scans. It were about 2 million, and it took about 3 hours. Is this normal? Because it sucks dick really.
I also have a HDMI thingy on my laptop. With HDMI you're supposed to lose no quality whatsoever. But because my tv screen is bigger then my laptop screen I actually do lose quality. Is there any way to prevent this?
TENKS

item.title: WTH, 2 million files?
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

I ran the virus scanner for the first time in over a year. Guess how many viruses it found? 0.
It took like 6 hours to scan though…

Read full topic

item.title: WTH, 2 million files?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

The files seem like they could be normal.

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:1, topic:238078”]I also have a HDMI thingy on my laptop. With HDMI you’re supposed to lose no quality whatsoever. But because my tv screen is bigger then my laptop screen I actually do lose quality. Is there any way to prevent this?

TENKS[/quote]

Your laptop screen doesn’t limit the resolution of another screen, just don’t set them up as a clone display, set them at different resolutions.

Read full topic

item.title: WTH, 2 million files?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I don’t bother with an antivirus program so I loaded up windirstat, 140k files taking up 280gb. 75k of the files are in /program files/, most of them are games.

Read full topic

item.title: WTH, 2 million files?
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:1, topic:238078”]I ran my AV like I do every week, and this time I noticed how many files it actually scans. It were about 2 million, and it took about 3 hours. Is this normal? Because it sucks dick really.

TENKS[/quote]Yes, it’s normal. I have like 15m+ files and a scan takes easily over 10 hours.

Read full topic
